text: today's recipe is super super simple
so simple that I almost thought to
myself when I was picking the recipes
maybe you shouldn't do this recipe
because it's too easy but then I thought
it's such a great idea and the ginger
yogurt that goes on the pineapple is so
yummy and easy to put together and would
be so good on so many different kinds of
fruit I just really wanted to share it
with you even though it's really easy
you want to prepare your pineapple by
removing the skin right go in once and
remove the skin and then if I feel like
I didn't do a good job I'll go back and
remove some of the eyes if they feel too
big like that one maybe doesn't need to
be there
I would go in with a little teeny melon
baller I've done that before but that
just seems excessive don't you think it
is cut into wedges you can remove the
core if you like I kind of like the core
because I like that sort of chewiness
the toughness but a lot of people like
to not eat that so I'll remove it
because I'm not doing this for me I'm
doing it for you you remove this part
and then cut it into wedges or slices
can put them on a platter Stopes not hot
all right down there
pineapple is very fragrant for the
ginger yogurt you're going to have to
grate some peeled ginger I like to peel
my ginger with the edge of a thin spoon
it's really easy and it only removes the
skin it doesn't remove any of the flesh
so it's a really good tool for that and
it's really easy to move around all the
little bumps so scrape off the skin you
can use a peeler for this too but I
actually think that the spoon works
better now for this recipe might seem a
little bit fussy and you don't have to
do it but I'm straining my ginger so I'm
going to grate some ginger a couple
teaspoons and then I'm going to strain
it just to get the juice and the juice
is going to go into the yogurt and that
way there are no little shreds of ginger
if you don't mind the shredded ginger
just go ahead and stir the whole thing
in you'll need to grate about a table
of fresh ginger to get two teaspoons of
the juice approximately if you feel like
you need to be gingery or you can always
add more I think it's going to be easier
if I put this the tip of this grater on
the board so you get a tablespoon of
ginger for maybe like an inch and a half
piece of ginger it depends because
ginger is so the size is not like the
uniform in any way so it's really hard
to tell hopefully you always have ginger
on hand because it's a very very tasty
and useful ingredient let's see if this
is enough so I have this sieve and I'm
just going to press it through the sieve
to create juice need about one to two
teaspoons and I think that's about just
over a teaspoon so I'm going to go ahead
and add that to my 1 cup of yogurt 3
tablespoons of honey 2 3
those were short tablespoons because I
find most yogurts aren't all that sour
and I don't want this to be overly sweet
if you like it sweeter please feel free
to adjust the flavoring to your liking
doesn't call for it but I'm going to put
a tiny pinch of salt in there drizzle
the yogurt over the top you may not need
all this yogurt you can save it in the
refrigerator I mean you can just eat a
bowl of this yogurt it would be super
delicious for breakfast and then
sprinkle with sliced almonds they can be
toasted pistachios would also be really
nice you know like a great brunch dish
right super easy and when people they're
not going to know people won't know and
when they take a bite of it they're just
going to be really surprised by how
delicious
the delicious and simple topping for any
you
